channel.title: yudel tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from yudel.

item.description: “by talking about how I came to change my mind, I might leave the door open for others to follow.” https://t.co/tlaIcZ3T4t
item.source:markdown: “by talking about how I came to change my mind, I might leave the door open for others to follow.” https://t.co/tlaIcZ3T4t

item.description: Looks like FB forgot to screen its new bot for antisemitism before letting it run loose. https://t.co/oEONG8i6rg
item.source:markdown: Looks like FB forgot to screen its new bot for antisemitism before letting it run loose. https://t.co/oEONG8i6rg

item.description:
@AvBronstein @emptywheel I think it’s possible that he doesn’t understand some basic technical details of how classified documents work. Like he might think that keeping a classified document hides it while not remembering that its existence is tracked by a central document database.

@AvBronstein @emptywheel There are some crimes one has to be both stupid and technologically illiterate to think one can get away with. I thing TFG has both qualifications.

@AvBronstein @emptywheel Note that while I claim experience with the stupid and computer illiterate, I know nothing about federal classified document systems.
Yes, but also: They are today providing a very worthwhile demonstration of what updating Clinton-era triangulation for today looks like. And it’s really, really not pretty. https://t.co/iNC4Plaj3h
item.source:markdown: Yes, but also: They are today providing a very worthwhile demonstration of what updating Clinton-era triangulation for today looks like. And it’s really, really not pretty. https://t.co/iNC4Plaj3h

item.description: Let’s not forget ex-Orthodox Jews. My favorite rabbi-professor in my YU student days subsequently drifted over to the FT theocons. https://t.co/CgCZWg1h4B

item.description: @racheleklein Maybe because I don’t have a safe, but I’m more worried about them seizing my phone and computers. That would be most inconvenient.

item.description: @avishaiw I think we’re about due for a sci-fi/action/Chanukah special.
item.source:markdown: @avishaiw I think we’re about due for a sci-fi/action/Chanukah special.

item.description:
@joshtpm But: Weren’t those boxes material that the Archives was expecting? In other words, documents that had already been cataloged? Which means these would be specific documents known by name and not by content?

@joshtpm Which is to say, not plans for stealth fighters, but documents generated in the course of ordinary business (and automatically named) but not yet archived?

@joshtpm If that is the case — and I could well be misremembering the facts of the Archives reporting — documents from 1/6 would fit the bill.

@joshtpm Could possibly be the sort of memo or emailed order to the National Guard that used to be called “a smoking gun” back in the day.

@joshtpm Could well be more prosaic, of course. But something to consider before rising to attack the warranted seizure of documents
@emptywheel Sad to believe he’s the heir of a publication which once published Hannah Arendt.
item.source:markdown: @emptywheel Sad to believe he’s the heir of a publication which once published Hannah Arendt.

item.description:
@JamesFallows So if you had been assigned to write the post-FBI raid speech/social media post, what world you have said?

@JamesFallows Desperately trying to imagine the scenario where the FBI executes a search warrant on Carter’s safe in Plains.

@JamesFallows Presumably it’s a lead safe, where the former president has stashed some Kryptonite stolen from NASA, because he’s worried by what Superman might do under Reagan’s control…. https://t.co/ay5dEylyfg
